medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening abdominal pain localized to the right lower quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced abdominal pain for 1 day, initially diffuse and then sharp and localized to the right lower quadrant over the past 12 hours. The pain has been constant and accompanied by nausea and 4 bouts of bilious emesis the previous night. She also felt febrile at home and was febrile in the ED to 101.4Â°F. The patient developed right-sided lower back pain since self-presenting to the ED at approximately 1700.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Thyroid cancer, Hashimoto's thyroiditis, Osteoarthritis, Subtotal thyroidectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Father - Atrial fibrillation, unspecified disease; Mother - unspecified retinopathy; Brother - Atrial fibrillation; Not specified for aunt and great-aunt.
